column1: [[Image:Essë.gif|left]]''Áre'' is also the name in Quenya of the thirty-first letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.  In Quenya this letter was originally named ''Áze'' and represented '''Z''' in written Quenya
column2: but over time the phonemes for "z" and "r" merged
column4: and it became superfluous.  This letter was then renamed ''Essë'' and represents '''SS'''
column5: but only in written Quenya.<ref name="Names"/>

column1: <!-- An extra blank line is needed to prevent the Etymology section title from indenting -->
The word derives from the [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] [[AR|AR<sup>1</sup>]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}

column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] gave the etymological root of the word for "day" as AR<sup>1</sup>
column3: which means that those words had always the radical letter ''r'' from [[Primitive Quendian]].  However
column4: in [[Appendix E]] he also gave the ancient form of ''Áre'' as ''Áze''
column5: which can not be reconciled with the older etymology since there is no sense in Primitive ''r'' becoming archaic ''z'' and then re-evolving to Quenya ''r'' again.

column1: According to our comprehension of the evolution of Quenya
column2: the ''z'' sound evolved from Primitive ''d'' or Primitive ''s''<ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]]
column3: [http://www.uib.no/people/hnohf/qevolution.pdf The Evolution from Primitive Elvish to Quenya]</ref> as in [[SRIS]] > ''[[hriz]]'' "to snow".  This
column4: combined with the [[Sindarin]] element ''[[as]]'' of ''[[Asfaloth]]'' (meaning "sunlit foam")<ref name="PE17"/> shows that Tolkien altered the derivation
column5: by changing theoretically the root AR to AS.
